overview: Events are developing in Milan in 1992. The city is undergoing a large-scale operation to combat financial fraud, bribery and money laundering. A case has been opened against Michel Mainaghi, the owner of a large pharmaceutical company that supplied HIV-infected blood. In the course of the investigation, the destinies of the young policeman Luca Pastore, who has become infected with HIV through the fault of the Mainaghi company, the mistress of businessman Veronica, parliamentary candidate Pietro Bosco, and advertiser Leonardo Notte, are intertwined in the course of the investigation.
